intro: Chavannesia imberbis, commonly known as the smooth chavannesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
